title: Write the Equation in Standard Form
text: It can be written in standard form as $$\frac{x^2}{9}+\frac{y^2}{1}=1$$.

title: Determine Whether the Major Axis is Horizontal or Vertical
text: Since $$1<9$$ and $$9$$ is in the $$x^2$$ term, the major axis is horizontal.

title: Find the endpoints of the major axis.
text: The endpoints will be the x-intercept. Since $$a^2=9$$ then $$a=-3$$ or $$a=3$$. The endpoint of the major axis are $$(-3,0)$$, $$(3,0)$$.

title: Find the endpoints of the minor axis.
text: The endpoints will be the y-intercepts. Since $$b^2=1$$, then $$b=-1$$ or $$b=1$$. The endpoints of the minor axis are $$(0,1)$$, $$(0,-1)$$.

title: Elimination of Choices
text: The graph with y-intercepts $$(0,1)$$, $$(0,-1)$$ and x-intercepts $$(-3,0)$$, $$(3,0)$$ is the answer.
